intro: Musineon lineare, commonly known as the linear musineon, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Musineon lineare thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
